## üî• Highlighted Papers

### 1. GLM-5: From Vibe Coding to Agentic Engineering
- **arXiv:** 2602.15763
- **Authors:** GLM-5 Team (Zhipu AI)
- **Link:** https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.15763
- **Note:** Major release from Chinese AI lab Zhipu AI, focusing on agentic engineering capabilities

### 2. The Geometry of Alignment Collapse: When Fine-Tuning Breaks Safety
- **arXiv:** 2602.15799
- **Authors:** Max Springer et al.
- **Link:** https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.15799
- **Note:** 27 pages investigating safety degradation during fine-tuning

### 3. CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
- **arXiv:** 2602.15823
- **Authors:** Zarif Ikram et al.
- **Link:** https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.15823
- **Note:** New method for editing LLM knowledge without full retraining

### 4. Operationalising the Superficial Alignment Hypothesis via Task Complexity
- **arXiv:** 2602.15829
- **Authors:** Tom√°s Vergara-Browne et al.
- **Link:** https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.15829
- **Note:** Investigates alignment behavior across task complexity levels

### 5. PERSONA: Dynamic and Compositional Inference-Time Personality Control
- **arXiv:** 2602.15669
- **Authors:** Xiachong Feng et al.
- **Link:** https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.15669
- **Note:** ICLR 2026 - Control LLM personality via activation vector algebra
